alert.note: Alert for Central Columbia River Gorge; Upper Hood River Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 08 at 2:47AM PST until December 08 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY THROUGH NOON TODAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches in the central Columbia Gorge, with 3 to 6 inches for the Hood River Valley. Spotty freezing rain with ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch are possible this morning. * WHERE...In Oregon, Upper Hood River Valley and Central Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, Central Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...Until noon PST today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow level will be at Columbia river level this morning, then rise to 800 feet this afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map

area.areaDesc: Central Columbia River Gorge; Upper Hood River Valley
